asset noun
(IN BUSINESS)
C1 [ C usually plural ] something valuable belonging to a person or organization that can be used for the payment of debts: liquid asset A lot of his wealth is in the form of stock, but he has little in liquid assets (= money or things that can easily be changed into money). A company's assets can consist of cash, investments, specialist knowledge, or copyright material. Compare
liabilities (liability) specialized
More examplesFewer examplesThe company's assets are periodically revalued.When it was obvious the company was going bankrupt, the government ordered all their assets to be frozen.

asset noun
(SPY)
[ C ] someone who provides secret information to a government or intelligence organization about what another government or organization is doing: He was a South American military officer who served as a CIA asset. There was a suggestion that a Western intelligence asset may have been involved.
More examplesFewer examplesMost assets are knowing agents, but some are "useful idiots" who provide a foreign agent with information through failures in information safety.
